ORDINANCE NO. 8659

AN ORDINANCE APPROPRIATING TWO HUNDRED MILLION PESOS (PHP. 200,000,000.00) AS SUPPLEMENTAL BUDGET NO. 13 FOR FISCAL YEAR 2020 TO COVER EXPENSES FOR COVID-19 VACCINES IN THE CITY OF MANILA

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, Section 2 of Republic Act. No. 11469, provides that "Presidential Proclamation No. 922, S. 2020, was issued declaring a State of Public Health Emergency throughout the Philippines due to the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the Code Alert System for COVID-19 was raised to Code Red Sublevel Two (2) in accordance with the recommendation of the Department of Health (DOH) and the Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases. Further, Presidential Proclamation No. 929, S. 2020, was issued declaring a State of Calamity throughout the Philippines and imposed an Enhanced Community Quarantine throughout Luzon;    

In view of the continuing rise of confirmed cases of COVID-19, the serious threat to the health, safety, security, and lives of our countrymen, the long-term adverse effects on their means of livelihood, and the severe disruption of economic activities, a state of national emergency is hereby declared over the entire country";    

WHEREAS, the Local Government Code of 1991, states that "every local government unit shall exercise the powers expressly granted, those necessarily implied therefrom, as well as powers necessary, appropriate, or incidental for its efficient and effective governance, and those which are essential to the promotion of the general welfare. Within their respective territorial jurisdictions, local government units shall ensure and support, among other things, the preservation and enrichment of culture, promote health and safety, enhance the right of the people to a balanced ecology, encourage and support the development of appropriate and self-reliant scientific and technological capabilities, improve public morals, enhance economic prosperity and social justice, promote full employment among their residents, maintain peace and order, and preserve the comfort and convenience of their inhabitants" (Section 16 of Republic Act No. 7160);    

WHEREAS, the same Code provides that "All budgetary proposals shall be included and considered in the budget preparation process. After the local chief executive concerned shall have submitted the executive budget to the sanggunian, no ordinance providing for a supplemental budget shall be enacted, except when supported by funds actually available as certified by the local treasurer or by new revenue sources. 

A supplemental budget may also be enacted in times of public calamity by way of budgetary realignment to set aside appropriations for the purchase of supplies and materials or the payment of services which are exceptionally urgent or absolutely indispensable to prevent imminent danger to, or loss of, life or property, in the jurisdiction of the local government unit or in other areas declared by the President in a state of calamity. Such ordinance shall clearly indicate the sources of funds available for appropriations, as certified under oath by the local treasurer and local accountant and attested by the local chief executive, and the various items of appropriations affected and the reasons for the change". (Section 321 of Republic Act No. 7160);    

WHEREAS, earlier today, the local legislative body approved Resolution No. 13, Series of 2020, adopted by the Executive Committee of the City Development Council on August 5, 2020, entitled: "A RESOLUTION APPROVING THE AMENDMENT OF THE ANNUAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM OR ISSUANCE OF A SUPPLEMENTAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM FOR FY 2020 IN CONNECTION WITH THE CITY OF MANILA'S ACTION PLAN AGAINST COVID-19 SPECIFICALLY THE PROVISION FOR THE DRUGS AND MEDICINES EXPENSES FOR THE PURCHASE OF VACCINES AGAINST COVID-19 IN THE AMOUNT OF TWO HUNDRED MILLION PESOS (PHP. 200,000,000.00)": NOW, THEREFORE,    

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in special session assembled, THAT:    

SECTION 1. The Supplemental Budget of the City Government of Manila for Fiscal Year 2020 in the amount of Two Hundred Million Pesos (PHP 200,000,000.00) is hereby approved.    

SEC. 2. Source of the Fund. - The funds for the Supplemental Budget shall be sourced from funds actually available from new revenue source in the total amount of Two Hundred Million Pesos (PHP 200,000,000.00).    

SEC. 3. Use of Funds. - The amount of Two Hundred Million Pesos (PHP 200,000,000.00) is hereby appropriated under the Manila Health Department (Maintenance and Other Operating Expenses - Drugs and Medicines Expenses) for the procurement of vaccines against Covid-19.

SEC. 4. Effectivity Clause. - This Ordinance shall take effect immediately upon its approval.    

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on August 6, 2020. 


August 19, 2020

THE HONORABLE MEMBERS

Sangguniang Panglungsod

City of Manila, Metro Manila

Gentlemen and Ladies:

THRU: HON. FRANCISCO M. DOMAGOSO City Mayor    

Pursuant to the provisions of Republic Act (R.A.) No. 7160 (Local Government Code of 1991), our review of the FY 2020 Supplemental Budget No. 13 of the City of Manila, involving an appropriation of TWO HUNDRED MILLION PESOS (P200,000,000.00) under Ordinance No. 8659, submitted to this Office for review on 10 August 2020 reveals substantial compliance with the same law and its Implementing Rules and Regulations (IRR).    

Accordingly, the said Ordinance is declared operative in its entirety effective on the date of its approval, subject to the posting requirements under Section 59 of R. A. No. 7160.    

Please be advised of compliance with the following guidelines:

1. All COVID-19-related programs/projects/activities (PPAs) shall conform with the provisions of Local Budget Circular No. 124¹ dated 26 March 2020. Further, those PPAs shall also be part of the approved Annual Investment Programs (AIP), otherwise, local development council shall prepare a supplemental AIP for the purpose to be approved by the local sanggunian.    

2. All procurement of goods, supplies and materials, equipment, infrastructure/civil works and consulting services shall be subject to the pertinent provisions of R.A. No. 9184 (Government Procurement Reform Act) and its Revised IRR; and prior clearances from pertinent agencies as may be appropriate/needed. In addition, all procurement shall be included in the duly approved Annual Procurement Plan.    

It is understood that this review action does not authorize any item of appropriation that is specifically prohibited by or inconsistent with the provisions of law.    

It is further understood that the FY 2020 Supplemental Budget No. 13 of the City of Manila shall operationalize approved local development plans.

Policy Guidelines on the Provision of Funds by Local Government Units for Programs, Projects and Activities to Address the Corona Virus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Situation.    

Compliance with all existing laws, rules and regulations shall be the responsibility of the City of Manila.    

Very truly yours,

By Authority of the Secretary of Budget and Management:

RUBY P. MURO
Director IV
short_text: This ordinance allocates PhP200,000,000.00 as Supplemental Budget No. 13 for Fiscal Year 2020, to be used by the Manila Health Department specifically for the procurement of COVID-19 vaccines. The funding was approved following Resolution No. 13, Series of 2020, by the City Development Council, and is sourced from new revenue. The ordinance ensures that Manila is financially prepared to acquire vaccines to protect public health and combat the spread of COVID-19.

ORDINANCE NO. 8658

AN ORDINANCE AMENDING ORDINANCE NOS. 8647 AND 8616 BY IMPOSING THE CURFEW IN THE CITY OF MANILA ACCORDING TO THE QUARANTINE CLASSIFICATIONS AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, on March 12, 2020, the Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Disease, with the approval of President Rodrigo Roa Duterte. raised the Code Alert Level to Code Red Sublevel Two and the imposition of stringent Social Distancing Measures in the National Capital Region (NCR) for thirty (30) days, effective March 15, 2020;

WHEREAS, the Metro Manila Council, during the meeting held on March 14, 2020, agreed to pass a resolution for all Local Government Unit in the NCR to pass an Ordinance implementing a curfew for all residents and persons in the jurisdiction of the LGUs between 8:00 pm to 5:00 am to further implement the SOCIAL DISTANCING measures to CONTAIN and DELAY the further spread of the Covid-19 in the Metropolitan Area, and to the whole country;

WHEREAS, this measure is necessary during the duration of the imposition of the Community Quarantine ordered by the President: NOW, THEREFORE,

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

SECTION 1. Imposition of Curfew Hours; Covered Persons. - There is hereby imposed curfew hours for all persons in the City of Manila, depending on the quarantine classification of the National Capital Region, to wit:

Enhanced Community Quarantine - between Eight O'clock in the evening (8:00 pm) to Five O'clock in the morning (5:00 am).

Modified Enhanced Community Quarantine between Eight O'clock in the evening (8:00 pm) to Five O'clock in the morning (5:00 am).

General Community Quarantine - between Ten O'clock in the evening (10:00 pm) to Five O'clock in the morning (5:00 am).

SEC. 2. Exceptions. During curfew hours, no persons shall be allowed in the streets, commercial establishments, recreation centers, malls or any other areas outside the immediate vicinity of their residence, except in cases of emergency or for the purpose of purchase of food and essential basic necessities and prime commodities and work-related travels.

The movement of cargoes within the City of Manila shall be unhampered.

SEC. 3. Role of the Barangays. - The Punong Barangay, members of the Barangay Council and the duly designated Barangay Tanods are hereby authorized to implement the provision of this Ordinance

SEC. 4. Guidelines in Apprehension. - Offenders of this Ordinance shall be apprehended in accordance with the guidelines to implement the provisions of this Ordinance:

1. The apprehending official or officer shall, without necessary delay, notify the family member/s of the offender and release the offender in recognizance to said family member/s with the understanding that the offender shall be submitted to the Punong Barangay for the corresponding penalty under Section 5 of this Ordinance;

2. facility of the barangay where the apprehension was made for not more than twenty-four (24) hours, and thereafter if the release of the offender to his/her family member cannot be reasonably accomplished, the Punong Barangay concerned shall turn over the offender to the Manila Department of Social Welfare Office concerned for proper disposition;

3. For an offender who is homeless, abandoned, neglected, or have no known family member, the apprehending official or officer shall refer the offender to the custody of the Manila Department of Social Welfare concerned within twenty-four (24) hours of apprehension;

4. Those who were apprehended for the violation(s) under this Ordinance and detained for more than two (2) days may be released by the prosecutor on recognizance upon signing of an undertaking that on repetition of the same offense, the full force of the Ordinance will be applied:

SEC. 3. EFFECTIVITY. - This Ordinance shall take effect upon its approval.

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on August 5, 2020.
short_text: This ordinance amends Ordinance Nos. 8647 and 8616 by updating the curfew hours in the City of Manila based on the prevailing quarantine classification. Under Enhanced and Modified Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ/MECQ), curfew is from 8:00 PM to 5:00 AM; under General Community Quarantine (GCQ), it is from 10:00 PM to 5:00 AM. Certain exceptions are allowed, such as for emergencies, essential purchases, and work-related travel. Barangay officials and tanods are empowered to enforce the curfew, with specific guidelines for apprehension, release, and handling of offenders. Special provisions are included for vulnerable individuals, such as the homeless or those without family.
fines: Penalties to be determined by the Punong Barangay; release and monitoring procedures apply

short_text: This ordinance authorizes Supplemental Budget No. 12 in the amount of Php40,000,000.00 through budgetary realignment from the 20% City Development Fund allocated to the Public Health Laboratory. The funds are designated for COVID-19 testing needs in Manila. Specifically, Php20 million is allocated for medical, dental, and laboratory supplies (testing reagents), Php10 million for laboratory testing expenses, and Php10 million for the purchase of medical equipment. The measure aligns with national policies on pandemic response and ensures the Manila Health Department has the resources necessary to manage local testing efforts.

ORDINANCE NO. 8656

AN ORDINANCE ABOLISHING SOME POSITIONS TO GIVE WAY TO THE CREATION OF MORE ESSENTIAL POSITIONS IN THE DEPARTMENT OF ASSESSMENT, MANILA

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, real property taxes are undoubtedly a major source of revenues to finance the various programs and projects of the City of Manila, as well as the delivery of basic services to its constituents;

WHEREAS, the Department of Assessment has in its custody approximately 2 Million realty tax records comprising of Tax Declarations, Field Appraisal and Assessment Sheets (FAAS) and its supporting documents covering the period from 1979 to present and therefore there is a need to protect these tax records from natural or man-made disasters which may affect and potentially damage these vital documents;

WHEREAS, change is inevitable and therefore there is a need to cope up with the trend especially now where the current digital systems have evolved over time, thus, the City of Manila is in the process of digital transformation to comply with the Ease of Doing Business subject to the health protocols required by the Inter Agency Task Force (IATF) for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases;

WHEREAS, in order to effectively implement the conversion of these paper-based records to digitize documents, there is a need to strengthen the Assessment Records Management Division by creating two (2) additional positions to handle the technical operation of the digitized documents. To ensure that all laws and policies governing the appraisal and assessment of real properties are properly executed a Legal Division is also imperative to be created to handle the legal matters of the department;

WHEREAS, in order to give way to the creation of these new positions which we think are very essential during this time of digital transformation, thirteen (13) regular plantilla items which are hardly being filled up due to existing CSC requirements under R. A. 9646, known as the "Real Estate Service Act" shall be abolished for the purpose: NOW, THEREFORE,

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

Further, the herein subject positions shall be automatically funded through the succeeding Annual City Budget as part of the plantilla of personnel of the Department of Assessment.

The changes support the protection and digitization of over 2 million real property tax records and enhance compliance with modern governance standards. Funding for the new positions is reallocated from the abolished posts within the 2020 Executive Budget.

ORDINANCE NO. 8650

AN ORDINANCE FURTHERMORE AMENDING SECTION 2.a OF ORDINANCE NO. 7755 (UNDER TRICYCLE TERMINALS), AS AMENDED, BY INCLUDING THEREIN THE LOADING AND UNLOADING AREAS OF LORETO SAMPALOC TRICYCLE OPERATORS AND DRIVERS ASSOCIATION (LORTODA), INC., AND SECTION 2 OF ORDINANCE NO. 7871, AS AMENDED, BY INCLUDING THEREIN ITS ROUTE MEASURE CAPACITY

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

SECTION 1. Section 2.a (Tricycle Terminals) of Ordinance No. 7755, is hereby furthermore amended, by including therein the loading and unloading areas of Loreto Sampaloc Tricycle Operators and Drivers Association (LORTODA), Inc., to read as follows:

"LORETO SAMPALOC TRICYCLE OPERATORS AND DRIVERS ASSOCIATION (LORTODA), INC.

Loading and Unloading Areas

a. Legarda, Loreto, Rotonda and Vice Versa"

SEC. 2. Section 2 of Ordinance No. 7871, is hereby furthermore amended, by including therein the Route Measure Capacity and authorized route line of Loreto Sampaloc, Tricycle Operators and Divers Association, Inc., to read as follows

ASSOCIATION:
Loreto Sampaloc Tricycle Operators and Drivers Association (LORTODA), Inc

R.M.C.:
35 Units

ROUTE

The authorized route lines of operation shall be via Legarda corner A.H Lacson to J.P. Laurel and back, to A.H Lacson up to G. Tuazon right to Loreto right to Magsaysay St., Sta. Mesa and vice versa "

SEC. 3. Separability Clause. If any part or provision of this Ordinance is held or declared invalid or unconstitutional, the other provisions not affected thereby shall remain in full force and effect.

SEC. 4. Repealing Clause. All other local laws, decrees, orders, issuances, rules and regulations which are inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance are hereby repealed or modified accordingly

SEC. 5. Effectivity Clause. This Ordinance shall take effect upon its approval 2020.

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on June 25, 2020
short_text: This ordinance amends Ordinance Nos. 7755 and 7871 by officially designating loading and unloading areas for the Loreto Sampaloc Tricycle Operators and Drivers Association (LORTODA), Inc., and specifying its Route Measure Capacity (RMC) of 35 units. The authorized tricycle route includes areas from Legarda corner A.H. Lacson to J.P. Laurel and back, passing through G. Tuazon, Loreto, Magsaysay Street, and vice versa.

ORDINANCE NO. 8649

AN ORDINANCE AUTHORIZING SUPPLEMENTAL BUDGET NO. 10, SERIES OF 2020. THROUGH BUDGETARY REALIGNMENT, INVOLVING AN AMOUNT OF TWENTY MILLION PESOS (PHP 20,000,000.00), TO COVER LABORATORY TESTING SERVICES FOR COVID-19 TESTING IN THE CITY OF MANILA

WHEREAS, Section 2 of Republic Act. No. 11469 provides that "Presidential Proclamation No 922, S 2020, was issued declaring a State of Public Health Emergency throughout the Philippines due to the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the Code Alert System for COVID-19 was raised to Code Red Sublevel Two (2) in accordance with the recommendation of the Department of Health (DOH) and the Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases. Further, Presidential Proclamation No. 929, S. 2020, was issued declaring a State of Calamity throughout the Philippines and imposed an Enhanced Community Quarantine throughout Luzon;

In view of the continuing rise of confirmed cases of COVID-19, the serious threat to the health, safety, security, and lives of our countrymen, the long-term adverse effects on their means of livelihood, and the severe disruption of economic activities, a state of national emergency is hereby declared over the entire country.";

WHEREAS, both Proclamations enjoined all government agencies and Local Government Units (LGUs) to render full assistance to and cooperation with each other and mobilize the necessary resources to undertake critical, urgent, and appropriate disaster response aid and measures in a timely manner to curtail and eliminate the threat of COVID-19,

WHEREAS, in the same law, the President is empowered to "ensure that all Local Government Units (LGUs) are acting within the letter and spirit of all the rules, regulations and directives issued by the National Government pursuant to the said law, and are implementing standards of Community Quarantine consistent with what the National Government has laid down for the subject area, while allowing the LGUs to continue exercising their autonomy on matters undefined by the National Government or are within the parameters it has set, and are fully cooperating towards a unified, cohesive and orderly implementation of the national policy to address COVID-19" (Section 4 (g) of RA No. 11469),

WHEREAS, the Local Government Code states that "a supplemental budget may also be enacted in times of public calamity by way of budgetary realignment to set aside appropriations for the purchase of supplies and materials or the payment of services which are exceptionally urgent or absolutely indispensable to prevent imminent danger to, or loss of, life or property, in the jurisdiction of the local government unit or in other areas declared by the President in a state of calamity Such ordinances shall clearly indicate the sources of funds available for appropriations, as certified under oath by the local treasurer and local accountant and attested by the local chief executive, and the various items of appropriations affected and the reasons for the change" (Section 321 of Republic Act No. 7160),

WHEREAS, the Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) and the Department of Budget and Management (DBM) had issued a Joint Memorandum Circular (JMC) No. 01, dated 27 March 2020, providing additional guidelines on the utilization of the Twenty Percent (20%) of the Annual Internal Revenue Allotment for Development Projects in view of the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) situation;

WHEREAS, consequently, the following policy guidelines were provided for the Local Government Unit to comply, to wit;

"2.3 All COVID-19 related expenses to be funded by the LGUs should be part of their respective approved AIPs

In case the COVID-19-related expenses are not among those included in the approved AIP, the local development council shall prepare a supplemental investment program for the purpose, to be approved by the local sanggunian.

2.4. In case the LGUs opt to realign their existing PPAs under the 20% DF, including the continuing appropriations from previous years' 20% DF, for COVID-19-related expenses as authorized under this JMC, the LGUs concerned shall effect changes in their respective annual budgets through the following

a. Changes in annual budgets through supplemental budgets in accordance with Section 321 of the Code and Article 417 of its IRR, as amended by Administrative Order No. 47, S. 1993;"

WHEREAS, earlier today, the local legislative body approved Resolution No. 10, Series of 2020, adopted by the Executive Committee of the City Development Council on June 18. 2020, entitled. "A RESOLUTION APPROVING THE AMENDMENT OF THE ANNUAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM OR ISSUANCE OF A SUPPLEMENTAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM FOR FY 2020 IN CONNECTION WITH THE CITY OF MANILA'S ACTION PLAN AGAINST COVID-19 SPECIFICALLY THE PROVISION OF LABORATORY TESTING SERVICES FOR COVID-19 IN THE AMOUNT OF TWENTY MILLION PESOS (PHP. 20,000,000.00)": NOW, THEREFORE,

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in special session assembled, THAT;

SECTION 1. The Supplemental Budget of the City Government of Manila for Fiscal Year 2020 in the amount of Twenty Million Pesos (PhP. 20,000,000.00) is hereby approved.

SEC. 2. Source of Funds. - The source of funds for the Supplemental Budget in the total amount of Twenty Million Pesos (PhP. 20,000,000.00) shall be derived from the following sources:

a. 20% City Development Fund 
a.1. Social Development 
Public Health Laboratory 
PHP 20,000,000.00

SEC. 3. Use of Funds. - The amount of Twenty Million Pesos (PhP. 20,000,000.00) is hereby appropriated for the Supplemental Budget of the City Government of Manila under the following:

1. Manila Health Department (MHD) - Other Maintenance and Operating Expenses in the amount of Twenty Million Pesos (PhP. 20,000,000.00) for Covid-19 testing

SEC. 4. Effectivity Clause. - This Ordinance shall take effect immediately upon its approval.

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on June 22, 2020.
short_text:
It approves Supplemental Budget No. 10, amounting to PHP 20,000,000.00, through a budget realignment for Fiscal Year 2020. The funds come from the 20% City Development Fund allocated for social development under the Public Health Laboratory.

The entire amount is assigned to the Manila Health Department under Other Maintenance and Operating Expenses for the purpose of conducting COVID-19 laboratory testing in the City of Manila. This ordinance supports enhanced testing efforts as part of the city's COVID-19 response.

ORDINANCE NO. 8646

AN ORDINANCE GRANTING TAX RELIEF IN THE FORM OF TAX CREDIT WORTH ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND PESOS (PHP. 100,000.00) TO ALL HOTELS, MOTELS, DORMITORIES AND OTHER SIMILAR ESTABLISHMENTS WHICH ACCORDED FREE LODGING SERVICES TO FRONTLINERS DURING THE COVID-19 CRISIS

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, on 8 March 2020, President Rodrigo Duterte issued Proclamation No. 922 declaring a state of public health emergency throughout the Philippines due to the Novel Coronavirus or COVID-19 Outbreak;

WHEREAS, according to the World Health Organization, such virus is easily transmitted from one person to another which have caused an alarming rate of deaths among different nations;

WHEREAS, due to this health crisis, many public and private hospitals and other medical institutions were forced to work beyond their capacities. Most medical practitioners and hospital staff were asked to work extra hours to manage the sudden influx of COVID-19 patients. Additionally, as a safety measure, these health workers refrained from returning to their homes or going to public places to ensure that they do not transmit the virus;

WHEREAS, Section 3(c) of Republic Act No. 11469, or Bayanihan to Heal as One Act provides that there is an urgent need to undertake measures that will prevent the overburdening of the healthcare system".

WHEREAS, in response to the need of the health sector, hotels, motels, dormitories and other similar establishments accommodated these health workers for several days or weeks free of charge;

WHEREAS, the City Government of Manila values acts of generosity and solidarity especially during challenging times;

WHEREAS, Section 192 of the Local Government Code authorizes the City Government of Manila, through ordinances duly approved, to grant tax exemptions, incentives or reliefs under such terms and conditions as it may deem necessary: NOW, THEREFORE, 

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

SECTION 1. Scope. - The Tax Relief in the form of Tax Credit shall be worth One Hundred Thousand Pesos (Php 100,000.00) and may be applied on all forms of local business taxes, regulatory fees and service charges including the appropriate surcharge and penalty interests.

SEC. 2. Definition of terms. -

a. Tax Relief - Any program or incentive granted by the government that reduces the amount of tax owed by an individual or business entity.

b. Tax credit - A form of tax relief which may be applied by taxpayers as deductibles.

c. Frontliners - Individuals who were tasked to work during the height of he COVID-19 crisis, whether for hospital facilities or government offices.

d. Free Lodging - These are accommodation or housing services in the form of bed space or sleeping quarters provide free of charge during the COVID-19 crisis.

SEC. 3. Who may Avail. - The Tax Credit shall be granted to all hotels, motels, dormitories and other similar establishments which accorded free lodging services to Frontliners during the Covid-19 crisis as evidenced by substantial documentary proof.

SEC. 4. Period of Application. - The herein Tax Credit worth One Hundred Thousand Pesos (PhP. 100,000.00) may be claimed within a period of three years from the enactment of this Ordinance.

SEC. 5. Separability Clause. - If any part, section or provision of this Ordinance shall be held invalid or unconstitutional by a competent court, other parts or portions that are not affected thereby shall remain valid.

SEC. 6. Repealing Clause. - All ordinances or portions thereof which are contrary to the provisions of this Ordinance are hereby deemed repealed or modified accordingly.

SEC. 7. Effectivity Clause. - This Ordinance shall take effect upon its approval.

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on June 11, 2020.
short_text: This ordinance grants a tax credit worth  PhP100,000 to hotels, motels, dormitories, and similar establishments in Manila that provided free lodging to frontliners during the COVID-19 crisis. The credit may be applied to local business taxes, regulatory fees, and service charges, and can be claimed within three years from the ordinance's enactment, upon submission of valid documentation.

ORDINANCE NO. 8645

AN ORDINANCE WAIVING ALL LATE REGISTRATION FEES OF CIVIL DOCUMENTS INCURRED FROM 16 MARCH 2020 UNTIL 30 MAY 2020 DUE TO THE COVID-19 CRISIS

WHEREAS, on 16 March 2020, President Rodrigo Duterte issued Proclamation No. 929 declaring a state of calamity throughout the Philippines and placing the whole country under an Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) until 12 April 2020 subject to extensions and modifications;

WHEREAS, since 12 April 2020, the said Enhanced Community Quarantine has been modified and extended. As of 31 May 2020, the City of Manila is now under a Modified General Community Quarantine (MGCQ);

WHEREAS, due to the imposition of these policies, residents of Manila were unable to process the registration of their birth, marriage and death with the proper government offices which thus incur certain fees as penalty;

WHEREAS, on 25 March 2020, the Philippine Statistics Authority issued Memorandum Circular No. 2020-09 enjoining "all concerned Local Chief Executives and Local Civil Registrars to process the delayed registration of vital events within this ECQ period with waived payments".

WHEREAS, Section 16 of the Local Government Code of 1991, provides that: "Every local government unit shall exercise the powers expressly granted, those necessarily implied therefrom, as well as powers necessary, appropriate, or incidental for its efficient and effective governance, and those which are essential to the promotion of the general welfare. Within their respective territorial jurisdictions, local government units shall ensure and support, among other things, the preservation and enrichment of culture, promote health and safety, enhance the right of the people to a balanced ecology, encourage and support the development of appropriate and self-reliant scientific and technological capabilities, improve public morals, enhance economic prosperity and social justice, promote full employment among their residents, maintain peace and order, and preserve the comfort and convenience of their inhabitants": NOW, THEREFORE, 

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

SECTION 1. Coverage. - All penalty fees incurred from late registration of civil documents with the Manila Civil Registry Office from 16 March 2020 until 30 May 2020 are hereby waived.

SEC. 2. Repealing Clause. - Any provisions of ordinances, executive orders, issuances or rules and regulations inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance is hereby repealed, amended or modified accordingly.

SEC. 3. Effectivity Clause. - This Ordinance shall take effect upon its approval.

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on June 11, 2020.
short_text: This ordinance waives all late registration fees for civil documents—such as birth, marriage, and death certificates—filed with the Manila Civil Registry Office from March 16 to May 30, 2020. The waiver was implemented in response to difficulties experienced by Manila residents in processing vital records due to the restrictions of the Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) and Modified General Community Quarantine (MGCQ) during the COVID-19 crisis. The ordinance supports the Philippine Statistics Authority’s guidance to local government units to allow delayed registration without penalty during the pandemic.

ORDINANCE NO. 8644

AN ORDINANCE REQUIRING ALL PERSONS ENTERING AND TRANSACTING IN A COMMERCIAL ESTABLISHMENT, BUSINESS ESTABLISHMENT, REGARDLESS OF SIZE, NON-PROFIT, CHARITABLE AND RELIGIOUS
ESTABLISHMENTS, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, GOVERNMENT OFFICES, LOCAL AND NATIONAL, AND ALL OTHER ESTABLISHMENTS, WHETHER PUBLIC OR PRIVATE THAT RENDER SERVICES TO THE PUBLIC, TO WEAR A MASK OR ANY DO-IT-YOURSELF COVER THAT WILL SUFFICIENTLY COVER BOTH THE NOSE AND MOUTH

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, Section 15, Article II of the 1987 Philippine Constitution provides that
it is the State's policy to protect and promote the right to health of the people.

WHEREAS, Presidential Proclamation No. 922, Series of 2020, was issued
declaring a State of Public Health Emergency throughout the Philippines in view of the
Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) and raised the Code Alert System of COVID-19
to Code Red Sublevel 2;

WHEREAS, Presidential Proclamation 929, Series 2020, further declared a State
of Calamity throughout the Philippines and imposed an Enhanced Community Quarantine
(ECQ) throughout Luzon from 17 March 2020 to 12 April 2020, unless earlier lifted or
extended by the President as circumstances may warrant,

WHEREAS, the Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging
Infectious Diseases, through its spokesman, Cabinet Secretary Karlo Nograles,
announced in a virtual presser held on 2 April 2020, that wearing of face masks, or other
similar protective equipment, is now mandatory for people who will be going out of their
homes in areas under ECQ, to further minimize the spread of the COVID-19 virus;

WHEREAS, on 1 June 2020, the City of Manila, together with other cities and
municipality in the National Capital Region, has been declared to be under General
Community Quarantine;

WHEREAS, the COVID-19 virus continues to spread despite the downgrade from
Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) to Modified Enhanced Community Quarantine
(MECQ) then further to General Community Quarantine (GCQ);

WHEREAS, the use of a face mask in public and all other places outside one's
home is still important to curb the spread of the COVID-19 virus to protect the people of
the City of Manila: NOW, THEREFORE,

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

SECTION 1. TITLE. - This Ordinance shall be called the "NO MASK NO ENTRY ORDINANCE" for brevity.

SEC. 2. MANDATORY USE OF FACE MASK IN PUBLIC. - All persons who are entering and transacting in a commercial establishment, business establishment, regardless of size, non-profit, charitable, and religious establishments, educational institutions, government offices, local and national, and all other establishments that render services to the public, whether public or private, located within the territorial jurisdiction of the City of Manila are hereby MANDATED to use face masks. The face mask must sufficiently cover one's nose and mouth and must be worn at all times.

SEC. 3. FACE MASKS ALLOWED. Face masks, including earloop masks, indigenous, reusable, do-it-yourself masks, handkerchiefs, or such other protective equipment that sufficiently cover one's nose and mouth and can effectively lessen the transmission of COVID-19.

SEC. 4. RESPONSIBILITIES OF ESTABLISHMENTS. All commercial or business establishments, regardless of size, non-profit and religious establishments and educational institutions, government offices, local or national, located within the territorial jurisdiction of the City of Manila are directed to clearly display in conspicuous places in their establishments "NO MASK NO ENTRY" signs.

These establishments shall be responsible for the implementation of this Ordinance and ensure that people inside their premises are at all times properly wearing face masks sufficiently covering the nose and mouth.

SEC. 5. PENALTIES. Persons found in violation of this Ordinance shall be
refused entry inside the above-mentioned establishments and institutions.

There shall be imposed penalties for persons found in violation of this Ordinance,
to wit:

FIRST OFFENSE - One Thousand Pesos 
(PhP. 1,000.00)

SECOND OFFENSE - Two Thousand Pesos
(PhP. 2,000.00)
 
THIRD AND SUCCEEDING OFFENSE - Five Thousand Pesos
(PhP. 5,000.00) 

The following shall be the imposed penalties for establishments found in violation
of this Ordinance, to wit:

FIRST OFFENSE - One Thousand Pesos (PhP. 1,000.00)
SECOND OFFENSE - Three Thousand Pesos (PhP. 3,000.00) and Suspension of Business Permit for three (3) months
THIRD AND SUCCEEDING OFFENSE - Five Thousand Pesos (PhP. 5,000.00) and Cancellation of Business Permit

Penalties under this Ordinance are without prejudice to any charges and/or penalties that may be imposed under other existing laws.

SEC. 6. EXCEPTIONS. the following are exempted from liabilities under this Ordinance:

1. When a person/s is performing a task that makes it impossible to wear a mask,
PROVIDED that strict physical distancing must be observed.

2. In above-mentioned establishments that have physical distance for the persons
inside.

For purposes of this Ordinance, PHYSICAL DISTANCE must be 2 meters away from each other, unless otherwise defined by the Manila Health Department.

SEC. 7. REPEALING CLAUSE. - All other orders, regulations, issuances or parts thereof which are inconsistent with this Ordinance are hereby repealed or modified accordingly.

SEC. 8. SEPARABILITY CLAUSE. Any part of this Order that is declared null and void shall not have any effect on the entirety of this Ordinance.

SEC. 9. EFFECTIVITY. - This Ordinance shall take effect upon its approval.

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on June 25, 2020.
short_text: This ordinance, known as the "No Mask, No Entry Ordinance," mandates the wearing of face masks or any appropriate face covering (including DIY or reusable masks) that sufficiently covers the nose and mouth for all individuals entering and transacting in any public or private establishment in the City of Manila. These include businesses, schools, government offices, and other institutions serving the public. Establishments are required to post visible "No Mask, No Entry" signs and enforce compliance within their premises. Violators will face escalating fines starting at Php1,000 for individuals and Php1,000 to Php5,000 plus suspension or cancellation of permits for establishments. Exceptions are allowed for certain activities and where strict physical distancing (2 meters) is observed. This measure was enacted to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 during the community quarantine period.
fines:
Individuals: Php1,000 (1st), Php2,000 (2nd), Php5,000 (3rd and succeeding)

Establishments: Php1,000 (1st), Php3,000 + 3-month suspension (2nd), Php5,000 + permit cancellation (3rd and succeding)

ORDINANCE NO. 8643

AN ORDINANCE AMENDING ORDINANCE NO. 8633 BY HEREIN SUPPLEMENTAL BUDGET NO. 09, SERIES OF 2020, AUGMENTING THE AMOUNT ALLOCATED FOR THE CITY AMELIORATION CRISIS ASSISTANCE FUND (CACAF) FY 2020 - 2ND TRANCHE IN THE AMOUNT OF FIFTY MILLION PESOS (PHP. 50,000,000.00)

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, the Local Government Code states that "a supplemental budget may also be enacted in times of public calamity by way of budgetary realignment to set aside appropriations for the purchase of supplies and materials or the payment of services which are exceptionally urgent or absolutely indispensable to prevent imminent danger to, or loss of, life or property, in the jurisdiction of the local government unit or in other areas declared by the President in a state of calamity. Such ordinances shall clearly indicate the sources of funds available for appropriations, as certified under oath by the local treasurer and local accountant and attested by the local chief executive, and the various items of appropriations affected and the reasons for the change." [Section 321 of Republic Act No. 7160];

WHEREAS, on April 27th, 2020, the City Council of Manila passed Ordinance No. 8633 entitled: "An Ordinance authorizing the Supplemental Budget No. 05, Series of 2020, through Budgetary Realignment, involving an amount of Six Hundred Twenty-One Million Eight Hundred Ten Thousand Pesos (PhP. 621,810,000.00), for the City Amelioration Crisis Assistance Fund (CACAF) FY 2020-2nd Tranche" in accordance with Section 321 of R.A. No. 7160;

WHEREAS, the intention of the said Ordinance is to provide immediate assistance to all the families residing, whether temporary or permanently, in the City of Manila while the entire City is under the Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ), as ordered by the President;

WHEREAS, the City Amelioration Crisis Assistance Fund (CACAF) FY 2020 - 2nd Tranche was provided by the City of Manila because the supply of basic commodities has been scarce due to its high demand and production challenges causing difficulties in the immediate distribution of the relief goods to the entire population of the city;

WHEREAS, after the implementation of the CACAF FY 2020 - 2nd Tranche in the eight hundred ninety-six (896) Barangays, a number of barangays appealed for additional funding to accommodate those families who have not benefited from the said fund;

WHEREAS, earlier today, the local legislative body approved Resolution No. 9, Series of 2020, adopted May 20, 2020 by the Executive Committee of the City Development Council, entitled: "A RESOLUTION APPROVING THE AMENDMENT OF THE ANNUAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM OR ISSUANCE OF A SUPPLEMENTAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM FOR FY 2020 IN RELATION TO THE ADDITIONAL FIFTY MILLION PESOS (PHP. 50,000,000.00) CITY AMELIORATION CRISIS ASSISTANCE FUND SECOND TRANCHE AS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR RESIDENTS OF THE CITY OF MANILA": NOW, THEREFORE,

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

SECTION 1. Appropriations. - Ordinance No. 8633 is hereby amended by herein Supplemental Budget augmenting the amount of the City Amelioration Crisis Assistance Fund (CACAF) FY 2020-2nd Tranche by Fifty Million Pesos (PhP. 50,000,000.00).

SEC. 2. Sources of fund. - The source of funds for the Supplemental Budget in
the total amount of Fifty Million Pesos (PhP. 50,000,000.00), shall be derived from the
Urban Settlements Office - Capital Outlay Other Infrastructure Assets (Vertical Housing
Program).

SEC. 3. Use of funds. The amount of Fifty Million Pesos (PhP. 50,000,000.00) is hereby appropriated for the Supplemental Budget of the City Government of Manila as City Amelioration Crisis Assistance Fund 2nd Tranche under the Maintenance and Other Operating Expenses (MOOE) - Donation Account of the Manila Department of Social Welfare.

SEC. 4. Beneficiaries. - The amount of One Thousand Pesos (PhP. 1,000.00) per beneficiary shall be given to the barangay-identified beneficiaries, who were not able to avail of the funding from Ordinance No. 8633, as financial assistance to be distributed to various Barangays in the City of Manila to cushion the economic effect of COVID-19 crisis and to enable the people of Manila to purchase much needed food and supplies for their survival.

SEC. 5. Accountability. The amount appropriated in this Ordinance shall be
coursed through the barangays concerned, who shall be in-charge of the proper
liquidation of the said fund, subject to existing laws, rules and regulations.

SEC. 6. Effectivity Clause. - This Ordinance shall take effect upon its approval.

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on
May 21, 2020.
short_text: This ordinance amends Ordinance No. 8633 by approving Supplemental Budget No. 09, Series of 2020, which allocates an additional Php50,000,000.00 to the City Amelioration Crisis Assistance Fund (CACAF) FY 2020 – 2nd Tranche. The purpose of this augmentation is to provide financial assistance of Php1,000.00 per beneficiary to Manila residents who were not covered under the previous allocation. The funds are intended to help families cope with the economic challenges brought about by the COVID-19 crisis, particularly during the Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ). The funding will come from the Urban Settlements Office’s budget (specifically, Capital Outlay - Other Infrastructure Assets under the Vertical Housing Program) and will be distributed through the barangays, which will also handle liquidation and reporting in compliance with existing laws and regulations.

ORDINANCE NO. 8642

AN ORDINANCE AUTHORIZING SUPPLEMENTAL BUDGET NO. 08, SERIES OF 2020, THROUGH BUDGETARY REALIGNMENT, INVOLVING AN AMOUNT OF TWENTY-FIVE MILLION FIVE HUNDRED THOUSAND PESOS (PHP. 25,500,000.00). TO COVER THE LABORATORY TESTING SERVICES AND CONSTRUCTION OF
QUARANTINE FACILITIES OF THE CITY GOVERNMENT OF MANILA

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, Section 2 of Republic Act. No. 11469 provides that "Presidential Proclamation No. 922, s. 2020, was issued declaring a State of Public Health Emergency throughout the Philippines due to the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the Code Alert System for COVID-19 was raised to Code Red Sublevel Two (2) in accordance with the recommendation of the Department of Health (DOH) and the Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases. Further, Presidential Proclamation No. 929, s. 2020, was issued declaring a State of Calamity throughout the Philippines and imposed an Enhanced Community Quarantine throughout Luzon;

In view of the continuing rise of confirmed cases of COVID-19, the serious threat to the health, safety, security, and lives of our countrymen, the long-term adverse effects on their means of livelihood, and the severe disruption of economic activities, a state of
national emergency is hereby declared over the entire country.";

WHEREAS, both Proclamations enjoined all government agencies and Local Government Units (LGUs) to render full assistance to and cooperation with each other and mobilize the necessary resources to undertake critical, urgent, and appropriate disaster response aid and measures in a timely manner to curtail and eliminate the threat of COVID-19;

WHEREAS, in the same law, the President is empowered to "ensure that all Local Government Units (LGUs) are acting within the letter and spirit of all the rules, regulations and directives issued by the National Government pursuant to the said law, and are implementing standards of Community Quarantine consistent with what the National Government has laid down for the subject area, while allowing the LGUs to continue exercising their autonomy on matters undefined by the National Government or are within the parameters it has set, and are fully cooperating towards a unified, cohesive and orderly implementation of the national policy to address COVID-19." (Section 4 (g) of RA No. 11469);

WHEREAS, the Local Government Code states that "a supplemental budget may also be enacted in times of public calamity by way of budgetary realignment to set aside appropriations for the purchase of supplies and materials or the payment of services which are exceptionally urgent or absolutely indispensable to prevent imminent danger to, or loss of life or property, in the jurisdiction of the local government unit or in other areas declared by the President in a state of calamity. Such ordinances shall clearly indicate the sources of funds available for appropriations, as certified under oath by the local treasurer and local accountant and attested by the local chief executive, and the various items of appropriations affected and the reasons for the change." (Section 321 of Republic Act No. 7160);

WHEREAS, the Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) and the Department of Budget and Management (DBM) had issued a Joint Memorandum Circular (JMC) No. 01, dated 27 March 2020, providing additional guidelines on the utilization of the Twenty Percent (20%) of the Annual Internal Revenue Allotment for Development Projects in view of the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) situation;

WHEREAS, consequently, the following policy guidelines were provided for the Local Government Unit to comply; to wit:

"2.3 All COVID-19 related expenses to be funded by the LGUs should be part of their respective approved AIPs.

In case the COVID-19-related expenses are not among those included in the approved AIP, the local development council shall prepare a supplemental investment program for the purpose,
to be approved by the local sanggunian.

2.4. In case the LGUs opt to realign their existing PPAs under the 20% DF, including the continuing appropriations from previous years' 20% DF, for COVID-19-related expenses as authorized under this JMC, the LGUs concerned shall effect changes in their respective annual budgets through the following:

a. Changes in annual budgets through supplemental budgets in accordance with Section
321 of the Code and Article 417 of its IRR, as amended by Administrative Order No. 47, s.
1993;"

WHEREAS, earlier today, the local legislative body approved Resolution No. 8, Series of 2020, adopted by the Executive Committee of the City Development Council on May 13, 2020, entitled: "A RESOLUTION APPROVING THE AMENDMENT OF THE ANNUAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM OR ISSUANCE OF A SUPPLEMENTAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM FOR FY 2020 IN CONNECTION WITH THE CITY OF
MANILA'S ACTION PLAN AGAINST COVID-19 BY PROVIDING LABORATORY TESTING SERVICES AND THE CONSTRUCTION OF QUARANTINE FACILITIES IN THE AMOUNT OF TWENTY-FIVE MILLION FIVE HUNDRED THOUSAND PESOS (PHP. 25,500,000.00)": NOW, THEREFORE,

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in special session assembled, THAT;

SECTION 1. The Supplemental Budget of the City Government of Manila for Fiscal Year 2020 in the amount of Twenty-Five Million Five Hundred Thousand Pesos (PhP. 25,500,000.00) is hereby approved.

SEC. 2. Source of Funds. - The source of funds for the Supplemental Budget in the total amount of Twenty-Five Million Five Hundred Thousand Pesos (PhP. 25,500,000.00) shall be derived from the following sources:

a. 20% City Development Fund 
a.1. Onyx Center Island - from Pedro Gil to Estrada St.  
PHP 7,500,000.00 

a.2. Zobel Roxas Center Island from SSH to J.P. Rizal St. 
PHP 15,000,000.00 

a.3. Plaza Salvador Rueda - U.N. Avenue corner Taft Avenue 
PHP 3,000,000.00 

Total: 25,500,000.00

SEC. 3. Use of Funds. The amount of Twenty-Five Million Five Hundred Thousand Pesos (PhP. 25,500,000.00) is hereby appropriated for the Supplemental Budget of the City Government of Manila under the following:

1. Manila Health Department (MHD) - Other Maintenance and Operating Expenses in the amount of Ten Million Five Hundred Thousand Pesos (PhP. 10,500,000.00) for Covid-19 testing; and

2. Department of Engineering and Public Works - Other Infrastructure Assets in the amount of Fifteen Million Pesos (PhP. 15,000,000.00) for the construction/repair of space/building for quarantine facilities for Covid-19 patients and persons under monitoring/investigation.

SEC. 4. Effectivity Clause. - This Ordinance shall take effect immediately upon
its approval

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on May 14, 2020.
short_text: This ordinance approves Supplemental Budget No. 08, Series of 2020, reallocating PhP25,500,000.00 to fund COVID-19 response efforts in Manila. The budget will be sourced from the 20% City Development Fund, originally allocated to infrastructure projects, and redirected for pandemic-related needs. Specifically, PhP10.5 million will go to the Manila Health Department for laboratory testing services, while PhP15 million will support the Department of Engineering and Public Works in constructing or repairing quarantine facilities. This realignment aligns with national and local policy directives during the COVID-19 public health emergency.

ORDINANCE NO. 8641

AN ORDINANCE AUTHORIZING SUPPLEMENTAL BUDGET NO. 07, SERIES OF 2020, APPROPRIATING THE AMOUNT OF FIFTEEN MILLION THREE HUNDRED EIGHT THOUSAND SIX HUNDRED TWENTY PESOS (PHP. 15,308,620.00) FROM THE SPECIAL ACCOUNT IN THE GENERAL FUND TO THE MANILA HEALTH DEPARTMENT OTHER MAINTENANCE AND OPERATING EXPENSES AND DEPARTMENT OF ENGINEERING AND PUBLIC WORKS - CAPITAL OUTLAY

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, the number of COVID-19 cases within the Philippines continues to rise with more than 700 confirmed patients in the City of Manila as of 6 May 2020;

WHEREAS, together with the imposition of the Enhanced Community Quarantine, an increase in the conduct of COVID-19 testing within the City of Manila must be immediately effected;

WHEREAS, the utilization of this funding shall be subject to the usual local budgeting process pursuant to the pertinent provisions of the Local Government Code of 1991 (RA No. 7160);

WHEREAS, earlier today, the local legislative body approved Resolution No. 7, Series of 2020, adopted on May 7, 2020 by the Executive Committee of the City Development Council, entitled: "A RESOLUTION APPROVING THE AMENDMENT OF THE ANNUAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM OR ISSUANCE OF A SUPPLEMENTAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM FOR FY 2020 IN RELATION TO THE AMOUNT OF FIFTEEN MILLION THREE HUNDRED EIGHT THOUSAND SIX HUNDRED TWENTY PESOS (PHP. 15,308,620.00) COVERING THE BAYANIHAN GRANT AND APPROPRIATING IT FOR THE FOLLOWING (A) COVID-19 TESTING EXPENSES OF THE CITY OF MANILA UNDER THE MANILA HEALTH DEPARTMENT OTHER MAINTENANCE
AND OPERATING EXPENSES IN THE AMOUNT OF TEN MILLION PESOS (PHP. 10,000,000.00); AND (B) CONSTRUCTION REPAIR OF QUARANTINE FACILITIES OF THE CITY OF MANILA UNDER THE DEPARTMENT OF ENGINEERING AND PUBLIC WORKS-CAPITAL OUTLAY IN THE AMOUNT OF FIVE MILLION THREE HUNDRED
EIGHT THOUSAND SIX HUNDRED TWENTY PESOS (PHP. 5,308,620.00)";

WHEREAS, this Supplemental Budget is in accordance with Section 321 of Republic Act No. 7160 which provides that all budgetary proposal shall be included and considered in the budgetary preparation process. After the local chief executive concerned shall have submitted the Executive Budget to the sanggunian, no ordinance providing for a supplemental budget be enacted, except when supported by funds actually available as certified by the local treasurer or by new revenue sources.": NOW, THEREFORE,

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

SECTION 1. The Supplemental Budget of the City Government of Manila for Fiscal Year 2020 in the amount of Fifteen Million Three Hundred Eight Thousand Six Hundred Twenty Pesos (PhP. 15,308,620.00), from the Special Account in the General Fund is hereby approved.

SEC. 3. Use of Funds. The amount of Fifteen Million Three Hundred Eight Thousand Six Hundred Twenty Pesos (PHP 15,308,620.00), is hereby appropriated and broken down as follows:

Particulars
Manila Health Department - MOOE Other maintenance and Operating Expenses
Amount: PHP 10,000,000.00

Department of Engineering and Public Works- Capital Outlay Infrastructure Assets Other Infrastructure Assets
Amount: PHP 5,308,620.00

TOTAL: PHP 15,308,620.00

SEC. 4. Effectivity Clause. This Ordinance shall take effect immediately upon its approval.

short_text: This ordinance authorizes Supplemental Budget No. 07, Series of 2020, allocating Php15,308,620.00 from the Special Account in the General Fund to bolster Manila's COVID-19 response. Of the total amount, Php10 million will fund COVID-19 testing under the Manila Health Department's operating expenses, and Php5,308,620 will go to the Department of Engineering and Public Works for the construction or repair of quarantine facilities. The ordinance supports the city's intensified efforts amid the rising number of COVID-19 cases and is consistent with local and national public health emergency measures.

ORDINANCE NO. 8640

AN ORDINANCE AUTHORIZING THE REVERSION TO THE SPECIAL ACCOUNT IN THE GENERAL FUND THE AMOUNT OF FIFTEEN MILLION THREE HUNDRED EIGHT THOUSAND SIX HUNDRED TWENTY PESOS (PHP. 15,308,620.00) APPROPRIATED UNDER ORDINANCE NOS. 8629 AND 8638 COVERING THE BAYANIHAN GRANT

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, Section 322 of Republic Act No. 7160 otherwise known as the Local Government Code categorically provides:

"Section 322. Reversion of the Unexpended Balances of Appropriations, Continuing  appropriations. Unexpended balances of appropriations authorized in the annual appropriations ordinance shall revert to the unappropriated surplus of the general fund at the end of the fiscal year and shall not thereafter be available for the expenditure except by subsequent enactment. However, appropriations for capital outlays shall continue and remain valid until fully spent, reverted or the project is completed. Reversions of continuing appropriations shall not be allowed unless obligations therefor have been fully paid or otherwise settled.

The balances of continuing appropriations shall be reviewed as part of the annual budget preparation and the sanggunian concerned may approve, upon recommendation of the local chief executive, the reversion of funds no longer needed in connection with the activities funded by said continuing appropriations subject to the provisions of this Section".

WHEREAS, on 17 April 2020, the City Council of Manila enacted Ordinance No. 8629 which authorized Supplemental Budget No. 3, Series of 2020, appropriating the Bayanihan Grant to the City of Manila in the total amount of Two Hundred Ninety-Two Million Six Hundred Thousand Four Hundred Eighty-Seven Pesos (PhP. 292,600,487.00);

WHEREAS, on 27 April 2020, the City Council of Manila approved Ordinance No. 8638 which created Supplemental Budget No. 06, Series of 2020, appropriating thereby from the Special Account in the General Fund the amount of Thirty-Eight Million Pesos (PhP. 38,000,000.00) to the Manila Department of Social Welfare (MDSW) for welfare goods expenses;

WHEREAS, as of 6 May 2020, the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in the Philippines has increased to more than 10,000 with at least 650 deaths;

WHEREAS, in view of the Nation's effort to curtail the effects of the COVID-19 Pandemic, the City of Manila must quickly adapt measures to effectively finance and conduct more testing: NOW, THEREFORE 

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

SECTION 1. REVERSION. - The following funds are hereby reverted to the Special Account in the General Fund created for the Bayanihan Grant to the City of Manila under Section 5 of Ordinance No. 8629; to wit:

Particulars:
Reversion of Appropriations

Office of the Mayor(Welfare Goods Expenses)
Amount: PHP 9,399,000.00

Department of Social Welfare(Welfare Goods Expenses)
Amount: PHP 5,909,620.00

TOTAL: PHP 15,308,620.00

SEC. 2. EFFECTIVITY CLAUSE. - This Ordinance shall take effect immediately upon its approval.

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on May 7, 2020.
short_text: This ordinance authorizes the reversion of PhP15,308,620.00 back to the Special Account in the General Fund under the Bayanihan Grant, previously appropriated under Ordinance Nos. 8629 and 8638. The reversion includes PhP9,399,000.00 from the Office of the Mayor and PhP5,909,620.00 from the Department of Social Welfare, both originally allocated for welfare goods expenses. The reallocated funds are intended to support the City of Manila's ongoing COVID-19 response efforts, particularly testing and related needs.

full_text:
ORDINANCE NO. 8639

AN ORDINANCE GRANTING ONE MILLION PESOS (PHP. 1,000,000.00) AS ENDOWMENT BENEFIT TO ALL HEALTH WORKERS IN CITY-OWNED HOSPITALS AND HEALTH CENTERS WHO SUCCUMBED TO CORONAVIRUS DISEASE 2019 (COVID-19) IN THE LINE OF DUTY OR WHILE PERFORMING HIS/HER DUTIES TO
COMBAT THE SPREAD OF THE DISEASE IN THE CITY OF MANILA

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, on March 8, 2020, His Excellency, President RODRIGO ROA DUTERTE issued Proclamation No. 922 declaring a State of Public Health Emergency throughout the Philippines by reason of the looming COVID-19 threat;

WHEREAS, Proclamation No. 922 enjoins all government units to render full assistance and cooperation and mobilize the necessary resources to undertake critical, urgent and appropriate response and measures in a timely manner to curtail and eliminate the COVID-19 threat;

WHEREAS, on the same date, President Duterte adopted Resolution No. 11 Series of 2020 of the Inter-Agency Task Force (IATF) for the Management of emerging Infectious Disease, thus, placing the entire National Capital Region under community quarantine;

WHEREAS, on March 16, 2020, Presidential Proclamation No. 929 s. 2020 was issued declaring a State of Calamity throughout the Philippines and imposed an enhanced community quarantine (ECQ) throughout Luzon;

WHEREAS, to date, the Department of Health confirmed that a total of 1,245 healthcare workers in the country have been infected with COVID-19, with 27 succumbing to the disease, and of those who died, 21 are doctors while six are nurses;

WHEREAS, the country now records a 16% infection rate among healthcare workers, with the health department confirming a total of 7,777 cases of the disease nationwide as of 27 March 2020;

WHEREAS, on 09 April 2020 ("Araw ng Kagitingan"), President Duterte, in his message to the nation lauded our "Bagong Bayani" saying that ""As we face this unprecedented public health emergency that threatens the very survival of our society, let us all draw strength from the heroism of x x x these unnamed heroes in the fight against COVID-19. May their example give us the courage and strength to endure this pandemic and rise as a stronger and more resilient nation";

WHEREAS, to show our heartfelt admiration and gratitude to the selfless sacrifices
of our "Bagong Bayani", it is but proper to hand down to their beneficiaries an endowment
benefit given in their honor and memory: NOW, THEREFORE,

Be it ordained by the City Council of Manila, in session assembled, THAT:

SECTION 1. Title. This Ordinance shall be known as the "BAGONG BAYANI ENDOWMENT BENEFIT ORDINANCE OF 2020".

SEC. 2. Any Health Workers in City-owned Hospitals and Health Centers who succumbed to the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in the line of duty or while performing his/her duties to combat the spread of the disease in the City of Manila shall be entitled an endowment benefit amounting to ONE MILLION PESOS (PhP. 1,000,000.00).

In addition to the endowment mentioned in the preceding paragraph, the surviving children, if any, of the Health Worker shall be given a scholarship in the City's Schools and/or Universities.

SEC. 3. For purposes of this Ordinance, health workers shall mean all persons who are engaged in health and health-related work, and all persons employed in all City-owned Hospitals and Manila Health Department (MHD), regardless of their employment status.

SEC. 4. The following shall be the qualified beneficiaries of the health worker for
the endowment mentioned in the preceding section:

a.  If married, the surviving spouse and children, whether legitimate or illegitimate,
if any;
b.  If single, the surviving parent/s, or in their absence, the nearest ascendants; in
the absence of the latter, then the nearest descendants, and in their absence, the surviving siblings; and
c.  If unmarried but has a common law partner, then 30% of the benefit shall accrue to the latter and the remaining 70% to the children, whether legitimate or illegitimate.

SEC. 5. The Manila Health Department (MHD) shall implement the provisions of this Ordinance and shall issue the necessary guidelines within three (3) days from effectivity hereof. The beneficiary mentioned in the preceding section shall present an original or authenticated copy of the death certificate of the health worker with a certification from the handling physician that the cause of death was due to COVID-19.

SEC. 6. The Funds necessary to implement this Ordinance shall be sourced from monetary donations to the City of Manila and other available funds as certified by the City
Treasurer and subject to existing laws, rules and regulations.

SEC. 7. This Ordinance shall cover deaths of health workers which occurred from the start of the declaration of public health emergency throughout the Philippines on 08 March 2020 and shall continue to be in full force and effect until a vaccine for the COVID-19 has been developed and certified by the Food and Drug Administration.

SEC. 8. Separability. If any provision of this Ordinance is declared invalid or
unconstitutional by a Court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining parts thereof not
affected thereby, shall continue to be in full force and effect.

SEC. 9. Repealing Clause. All Ordinances, Resolutions, Executive Orders, Memoranda and Administrative Regulations or part/s thereof that are in conflict or inconsistent with the provision/s of this Ordinance are hereby repealed, amended or modified accordingly.

SEC. 10. Effectivity. - This Ordinance shall take effect immediately upon approval
and publication thereof.

This Ordinance was finally enacted by the City Council of Manila on April 30, 2020.
short_text: This ordinance grants an endowment benefit of Php1,000,000.00 to the beneficiaries of any health worker in city-owned hospitals and health centers who died from COVID-19 in the line of duty. In addition, surviving children are entitled to scholarships in the City’s schools or universities. The ordinance defines eligible beneficiaries and outlines implementation by the Manila Health Department. It applies retroactively from March 8, 2020, and remains in effect until a COVID-19 vaccine is developed and approved by the FDA.

ORDINANCE NO. 8637

AN ORDINANCE AUTHORIZING THE REVERSION TO THE SPECIAL ACCOUNT
IN THE GENERAL FUND OF THE UNUTILIZED APPROPRIATION IN THE AMOUNT
OF THIRTY-EIGHT MILLION PESOS (PHP. 38,000,000.00) IN THE SUPPLEMENTAL
BUDGET NO. 03, SERIES OF 2020, OR THE BAYANIHAN GRANT TO THE CITY OF
MANILA, AND FURTHER AUTHORIZING ITS CORRESPONDING APPROPRIATION
TO THE MANILA DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL WELFARE (MDSW) FOR WELFARE
GOODS EXPENSES

PREAMBLE

WHEREAS, Section 322 of Republic Act No. 7160 otherwise known as the Local Government Code categorically provides:

"Section 322. Reversion of the Unexpended Balances of Appropriations, Continuing Appropriations. - Unexpended balances of appropriations authorized in the annual appropriations ordinance shall revert to the unappropriated surplus of the general fund at the end of the fiscal year and shall not thereafter be available for the expenditure except by subsequent enactment. However, appropriations for capital outlays shall continue and remain valid until fully spent, reverted or the project is completed. Reversions of continuing appropriations shall not be allowed unless obligations therefor have been fully paid or otherwise settled.

The balances of continuing appropriations shall be reviewed as part of the annual budget preparation and the sanggunian concerned may approve, upon recommendation of the local chief executive, the reversion of funds no longer needed in connection with the activities funded by said continuing appropriations subject to the provisions of this Section."
